Compound multi-line cedvel (dark blue, red, gold, green); meşk exercises on p002; YEK ID 406000; IIIF ID 0000000398421

entries.title: Murakkaʿ / مرقعات
entries.date_ce: late 18th century (c. 1787 terminus ante quem, Fethizâde vakf seal)
key_features: TRIPLE-TECHNIQUE album: tughra + zerefşân + halkâr — all confirmed at IIIF resolution
Tughra calligraphy on gold zerefşân ground with polychrome halkar margins
Three calligraphers identified by ketebe: İsmâʿîl Zühdî, Mahmûd Tophanevî, Hâfız Yûsuf
Fethizâde Mustafa Efendi vakf seal dated AH 1202/1787-88 (terminus ante quem); YEK ID 325921; 20 pages

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
key_features: MATCHED HATIP EBRU COVER PAIR — identical silhouette marbled paper on front and rear covers; unique in corpus
Battal ebru + pink mulevven + grey mulevven interior margins; deliberate chromatic variety per opening
Derviş Ömer el-Cüdî meşk kaydı; sülüs-nesih Qaṣīdat al-Muḍariyya; YEK ID 705423; 5 folios

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
key_features: SILHOUETTED/STENCILED DECORATED PAPER (çiçekli kâğıt, probable 0.60) — dense gold floral margins on ALL calligraphy pages; halkar not excluded
Two full-page gold garden compositions with cypress trees (pp. 003r, 014l)
Zerkârî calligraphy substrate throughout; sülüs-nesih meşk format; YEK ID 705380; 13 folios / 16 pages

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
key_features: ŞEYH HAMDULLAH AH 901 — earliest securely dated muraqqaʿ in corpus; 4 ketebe records with variant name forms
Compound candy-stripe cedvel framing (5–7 bands: green, gold, salmon, cream diagonal stripes) on ALL pages
Bāyezīd II-era lacquer binding; blue-gold serlevha; sülüs-nesih-icāze; YEK ID 705373; 4 folios

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
key_features: FIVE-TECHNIQUE multi-calligrapher album: battal ebru + zerefşân + mulevven + hatip ebru cover + cetvelli
Karahisârî (960/1553) + Hâfız Osmân (1085/1675) — two of the 'three pillars' of Ottoman calligraphy in one album
8 named calligraphers across 170 years; 10 yaprak / 10 IIIF pages; YEK ID 705432

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
key_features: COMPREHENSIVE BATTAL EBRU — stone marbling on ALL surfaces: both covers AND all 5 interior openings
3–4 distinct battal ebru color palettes across openings (pink/rose → grey-blue/teal → lavender → cream/yellow-green)
Hüseyin Haffâfzâde ketebe on all 10 pieces; AH 1149 on pieces 3–4; YEK ID 705426; 10 yaprak
